paragraph.heading:
Dendrobium devonianum Paxton
, Paxton’s Mag. Bot. 7: 169, 1840

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium pulchellum Roxb. ex Lindl. var. devonianum (Paxton) Rchb.
f. in Ann. Bot. Syst. (Walpers) 6: 284, 1861.
Callista devoniana (Paxton) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 654, 1891.

Heterotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium devonianum Paxton var. rhodoneurum Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron. 1868: 682, 1868. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 310
( holotype : W-R 40052 )
.

Dendrobium moulmeinense C.S.P.Parish ex Hook.
f., Fl. Brit. India 5: 746, 1890.
Callista moulmeinensis
(C.S.P.Parish ex Hook.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 655, 1891. Type:— MYANMAR . Mon State: Mawlamyine District, Parish 310 ( holotype : K).

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Myitkyina District :
1065−1220 m
,
Jan 1953
,
Kolugam s.n.
( K ); Bhamo District :
Dickason 4109
( AMES ); same loc.,
25 Apr 1935
,
Dickason 4504
( AMES )
.
SAGAING . Hkampti District and Mawlaik District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 78)
; Katha District :
305 m
,
25 Mar 1916
,
AR 492
( RAF ), det. herbarium CAL
, ident. uncertain.
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District :
1220 m
,
Apr 1934
,
Dickason 3134
( AMES )
.
MON . Thaton District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 78)
; Mawlamyine District : types . Also reported from
Chin and Kayin states and Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 73)
and from Shan State by Saw Lwin (2007: 251) , but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern and southern China .

L.O.Williams, Bot.
Mus . Leafl
. 8: 107, 1940. Type :— MYANMAR . Chin State : Falam District ,
1830 m
,
28 Apr 1938
, Dickason 7779 ( holotype : AMES)

Callista arachnites Kuntze, Revis.

2: 654, 1891.

25: 103, 1963.
Dendrobium seidenfadenii Senghas & Bockemühl, Orchidee
(Hamburg) 29 (5) cppo: 2, 1978, nom. superfl. Type:— MYANMAR . Without locality: imp. Low ex Boxall 74 ( holotype : W-R 32355).

;
icon.

(vol. 50, t. 43 at K )

Distribution:— Northeastern India , Myanmar and Thailand .

Dendrobium dixanthum Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron . 1865: 674, 1865. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 21
( holotype : K; isotype: W-R 39696 )

Homotypic synonym:
Callista dixantha
(Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 654, 1891.

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Bhamo District :
150 m
,
Bogg s.n.
in
Mamyo Botanic Gardens 13534
( K )
.
SHAN . Taunggyi District :
May 1932
,
Dickason 1166
( AMES ); Kengtung District :
12 Mar 1957
,
Egerod B-
105
in Univ.
California Bot. Gard. access. no. 57.264-2
( K ), det. V . S . Summerhayes [1960]; same loc.,
13 Mar 1957
,
Egerod B-
105
in Univ.
California Bot. Gard
. s.n. ( TNS ), det. P . F . Hunt & V . S . Summerhayes [1962]
.
KAYIN . Thaungyin Valley :
21 Sep 1927
,
Swinhoe K 128
( K ), ident. uncertain
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type . Also reported from
Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 73)
, but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Note:— Two other sheets of the Egerod B-105 collection were referred to
D. crepidatum Lindl. & Paxton
; see there.

paragraph.materialsCitation: × donnesiae Hort., Gard. Chron ., ser. 3, 17: 402, 1895, in obs. ; Garden (London, 1871−1927) 47: 225, 1895. Type :— ORIGIN UNKNOWN (? Myanmar ). Cult. (probably not preserved)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimen examined:— ?
MYANMAR . Type
.
Distribution:— ?Endemic.

Note:— According to the protologue, a natural hybrid between
D. formosum
and
D. infundibulum
.

Dendrobium draconis Rchb.
f., Bot. Zeitung (Berlin) 20: 214, 1862. Types :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 132B
( syntype : W-R 32379 );
same loc., cult.
Day s.n.
( syntype : W-R 32379 )

Homotypic synonym:
Callista draconis
(Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 654, 1891.

Heterotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium eburneum Rchb.
f. ex Bateman , Bot. Mag. 90: t. 5459, 1864. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish s.n.
, cult.
Low s.n.
( holotype : K )
.

J.Scott, J. Agri-Hort. Soc. W.
India

,

in
Maymyo Bot. Gard. 13570
( K )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : types ; same loc.,
Parish 131
( K ). WITHOUT LOCALITY. Type
.
Distribution:— Northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand and Indochina.
Note:— Typification of this species requires further study.

Dendrobium ellipsophyllum
Tang & F.T.Wang, Acta Phytotax. Sin.
1: 81, 1951. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Peche s.n.
( holotype : K; isotype: BM)

Homotypic synonym:
Distichorchis ellipsophylla (Tang & F.T.Wang) M.A.Clem.
,
Telopea
10: 281, 2003.

Dendrobium revolutum
auctt. plur. non Lindl.

Specimens examined:—
MANDALAY . Mandalay District : 1926,
Swinhoe 60
( K )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type ; same loc.,
Parish 112
( K )
.
Distribution:— Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina, southwestern China and possibly Borneo.
